description:
'''Sierreño''' or '''Sierreña''', is a subgenre of [[regional Mexican]] music. It is derived from [[Norteño (music)|Norteño]] music and is based on melodic lines along with the composition of mainly [[guitar]] and sometimes [[accordion]].

The genre is widely popular in [[Mexico]] and in [[Mexican Americans|Mexican-American]] communities in the [[United States]]. The genre experienced a rise in popularity among [[Generation Z]]. The repertoire of sierreño groups is different in tradition than that of norteño groups; it includes [[ranchera]]s and [[corrido]]s, also adaptations of [[Sentimental ballad|ballads]] and almost all genres of [[Music of Latin America|Latin American music]]. 

The instruments most widely used in sierreño music include the [[Mexican twelve-string guitar|twelve-string guitar]], [[acoustic guitar]], and [[Bass guitar|electric bass]]. Less common instruments include the [[button accordion]], [[acoustic bass guitar|acoustic bass]], [[tololoche]], [[sousaphone]], [[tenor horn]], [[trombone]], and [[alto saxophone]].
